title: Software Engineer (.Net) Job at PayInvert
content:
PayInvert was founded by innovators who want a better payment system that is fast, easy, convenient and with no hidden charges. The aim has always been to eradicate long queues and time taken to make payments physically. We are providing a secure way to receive payments electronically from anyone anywhere in the world with a robust reporting system to help companies plan their growth significantly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Software Engineer (.Net)
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an experienced and skilled .NET Backend Engineer to join our innovative team focused on building robust and secure payment gateway solutions.
	You will play a pivotal role in developing, maintaining, and optimizing backend systems that power secure transactions for millions of customers.
	As a critical member of our engineering team, your expertise will directly impact our ability to deliver seamless and reliable fintech products.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, maintain, and enhance robust backend services using .NET and related technologies (.NET Core, ASP.NET, C#, SQL Server).
	Design, build, and optimize scalable APIs that power our payment gateway infrastructure.
	Implement industry-standard security practices, ensuring compliance with data protection regulations and PCI DSS standards.
	Collaborate closely with product managers, frontend engineers, and DevOps teams to develop and deliver high-quality fintech solutions.
	Conduct thorough testing, debugging, and troubleshooting of complex backend systems to ensure optimal performance and availability.
	Engage actively in code reviews, promoting best practices, coding standards, and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD).
	Develop technical documentation and support the onboarding of new engineering team members.
	Continuously monitor application performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimizations to ensure peak reliability and efficiency.


Required Qualifications


	3-5 years of professional backend engineering experience, specifically in .NET development.
	Proven experience building APIs, backend services, and integration solutions in fintech, payment processing, or related domains.
	Strong proficiency with .NET Core, ASP.NET, C#, and relational databases (SQL Server or PostgreSQL).
	Practical experience integrating with payment gateways, bank APIs, third-party services, and understanding of financial systems.
	Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
	Solid understanding of security best practices, data encryption, tokenization, authentication, and authorization standards.
	Ability to manage tasks independently while effectively collaborating in an agile, team-oriented environment.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Familiarity with frontend frameworks such as React or Angular.
	Experience with microservices architecture, message queues (RabbitMQ, Kafka), and event-driven design.
	Working knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab).
	Previous experience working within compliance frameworks (PCI DSS, GDPR, ISO27001).


Skills and Competencies:


	Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical thinking, and attention to detail.
	Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate across teams and stakeholders.
	Demonstrated ability to deliver high-quality software solutions in fast-paced environments.
	Proactive learner, continuously seeking to improve technical knowledge and skills.

title: Administrative Personnel / Receptionist Job at Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry
keyword: lagos chamber of commerce and industry
content:
The Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI) isa prominent private sector group in Nigeria, serving as the premier chamber of commerce.Founded in 1888 and incorporated in 1950, it's a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting and protecting trade and industry. The LCCI represents the business community's voice on matters affecting trade, industry, commerce, and agriculture, and also engages in public policy advocacy and trade promotion.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Personnel / Receptionist

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Business Education Services and Training (Innovation Hub)
Reports to:Hub Manager / B.E.S.T Head
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking an organized, friendly, and efficient administrative professional to manage front desk operations and provide vital administrative support at our Innovation Hub.


Role Overview


	You’ll be the first point of contact for visitors and clients—delivering world-class customer service, managing administrative tasks, and keeping daily operations running smoothly.


Key Responsibilities


	Welcome visitors and guide them appropriately
	Manage calls, emails, bookings, and schedules
	Prepare official documents, memos, and correspondence
	Maintain office files, supplies, and expense records
	Coordinate workspace assignments and internet access for clients
	Keep reception and common areas neat and organized.


Requirements


	B.Sc. in Business Administration, Office Management, or related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar administrative role
	Strong communication and customer service orientation
	Excellent organization, multitasking, and time management skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and administrative tools.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work in a dynamic, innovation-driven environment
	Competitive compensation and support for career growth
	Respectful and collaborative team culture.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume and a cover letter to: recruitment@lagoschamber.com using "Administrative Personnel / Receptionist" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Information Technology Officer Job at Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry
keyword: lagos chamber of commerce and industry
content:
The Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI) isthe leading private sector group in Nigeria, established to promote and protect trade and industry. Founded in 1888 and incorporated in 1950, it represents the interests of the business community in Lagos and beyond, advocating for policies that support trade, industry, commerce, and agriculture. The LCCI also provides business development services, training, and information to its members.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Information Technology Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Department: Business Education Services and Training (Innovation Hub)
Reports to: Hub Manager (Assistant Manager)
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	The Lagos Chamber of Commerce and Industry (LCCI)—Africa’s foremost Chamber of Commerce—is inviting applications from experienced and driven IT professional to support and scale our digital infrastructure at the *LCCI-BOI Innovation Hub*.


Role Overview


	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining robust IT systems and network architecture, ensuring uninterrupted technology operations, and providing innovative solutions to optimize performance and security.


Key Responsibilities


	Deliver prompt IT support across hardware, software, and network issues
	Manage and monitor infrastructure: routers, switches, firewalls, VPNs
	Maintain cybersecurity protocols and backup systems
	Support ERP system administration (Odoo 16) and customization
	Recommend and implement new tech tools and solutions
	Support digital onboarding and IT asset management
	Collaborate with internal teams for tech-driven problem-solving


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in IT operations
	Proficiency in networking, cybersecurity, and ERP systems
	Working knowledge of Windows, Linux, and macOS
	Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, XML (basic level)
	Excellent troubleshooting, communication, and documentation skills
	Certifications such as CCNA, CompTIA+, or Microsoft preferred.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary & employee benefits
	Career growth in a tech-forward organization
	Supportive, collaborative work environment
	Opportunities to lead innovation within a respected institution.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a cover letter to: recruitment@lagoschamber.com using “Information Technology Officer” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Club Manager Job at Quicky Chillis
content:
Quicky Chillis, a 24-hour restaurant at Governor's Road, Ikotun, Lagos, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Club Manager
Job Location: Ikotun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Staff management: Supervising bartenders, security, DJs, and other staff.
	Customer service: Ensuring patrons have a positive experience.
	Event planning: Coordinating theme nights, live performances, and special events.
	Marketing and promotion: Promoting the club through social media, advertising, and events.
	Financial management: Managing budgets, inventory, and revenue.
	Safety and security: Ensuring a safe environment for patrons and staff.
	Compliance: Adhering to laws, regulations, and licensing requirements.
	Inventory management: Managing liquor, supplies, and equipment.
	Conflict resolution: Handling customer complaints and resolving issues.
	Leadership: Motivating and managing staff.
	Communication: Effective communication with staff, patrons, and stakeholders.
	Problem-solving: Handling unexpected issues and finding solutions.
	Time management: Managing multiple tasks and responsibilities.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc / Master's Degree with 5 - 10 years of work experience.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chilisbyebevande247@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
